plugin_desc: ClickHouse Exporter is used to collect and export metrics from ClickHouse databases, including connection counts, query performance, cache usage, and error rates, to help monitor the health and performance of ClickHouse instances.
name: ClickHouse

metrics.name: clickhouse_uptime
metrics.description: Records the continuous running time of ClickHouse service from startup to current, reflecting service stability and continuity. It helps identify frequent restarts, with long uptime usually indicating stable operation.

metrics.name: clickhouse_filesystem_logs_path_available_bytes
metrics.description: Indicates available disk space (in bytes) for ClickHouse log storage path. Monitoring it prevents service anomalies due to log storage exhaustion, ensuring normal log writing and retention.

metrics.name: clickhouse_filesystem_logs_path_total_bytes
metrics.description: Represents total disk space (bytes) of ClickHouse log storage path, reflecting the overall capacity of the log partition. Combined with available space, it calculates log space usage for capacity planning.

metrics.name: clickhouse_filesystem_logs_path_used_bytes
metrics.description: Records used disk space (bytes) of ClickHouse log storage path, showing log growth trends. It helps judge log generation rate, facilitating timely cleanup or expansion to avoid space shortage.

metrics.name: clickhouse_filesystem_main_path_available_bytes
metrics.description: Indicates available disk space (bytes) for ClickHouse main data storage path, a key indicator for core data storage, directly affecting data writing and service availability.

metrics.name: clickhouse_filesystem_main_path_total_bytes
metrics.description: Represents total disk space (bytes) of ClickHouse main data storage path, reflecting the total capacity of the main data partition. Combined with available space, it calculates storage usage for expansion decisions.

metrics.name: clickhouse_filesystem_main_path_used_bytes
metrics.description: Records used disk space (bytes) of ClickHouse main data storage path, a core indicator for monitoring data growth. Trend analysis helps predict storage needs and prevent write failures due to space exhaustion.

metrics.name: clickhouse_global_thread
metrics.description: Represents the total number of global threads in ClickHouse, reflecting the basic concurrent processing capacity. Global threads coordinate various tasks, and their quantity is closely related to service performance.

metrics.name: clickhouse_global_thread_active
metrics.description: Indicates the number of active global threads in ClickHouse, reflecting real-time concurrent task processing pressure. Excessively high active threads may indicate heavy load, requiring attention to resource bottlenecks.

metrics.name: clickhouse_global_thread_scheduled
metrics.description: Records the number of scheduled global threads in ClickHouse, reflecting the efficiency of thread scheduling. The difference between scheduled and active threads indicates task queuing.

metrics.name: clickhouse_local_thread
metrics.description: Represents the total number of local threads in ClickHouse, responsible for node-level tasks, reflecting a single node's local task processing capacity, related to node performance in distributed deployment.

metrics.name: clickhouse_http_rejected_connections
metrics.description: Records the number of rejected HTTP connections by ClickHouse, usually due to exceeding connection limits or permission issues. A rise indicates client request overload, requiring connection configuration adjustments.

metrics.name: clickhouse_kafka_assigned_partitions
metrics.description: Indicates the number of Kafka partitions assigned to ClickHouse, reflecting load distribution of Kafka message consumption. Balanced partition assignment affects consumption efficiency and data synchronization speed.

metrics.name: clickhouse_kafka_consumers
metrics.description: Records the total number of Kafka consumers in ClickHouse, a basic indicator of Kafka message consumption capacity. The number should match Kafka partitions to avoid resource waste or consumption delays.

metrics.name: clickhouse_kafka_consumers_in_use
metrics.description: Indicates the number of actively used Kafka consumers in ClickHouse, reflecting real-time Kafka message consumption activity. Combined with total consumers, it shows consumption resource utilization.

metrics.name: clickhouse_kafka_producers
metrics.description: Records the total number of Kafka producers in ClickHouse, reflecting the capacity to write data to Kafka. The number should be adjusted based on data output to ensure timely writing to Kafka.

metrics.name: clickhouse_kafka_writes
metrics.description: Records the number of write operations from ClickHouse to Kafka, directly reflecting data interaction frequency with Kafka. It monitors data flow efficiency from ClickHouse to Kafka.

metrics.name: clickhouse_write
metrics.description: Records the total number of write operations in ClickHouse, including local and distributed tables, a core indicator of data write pressure. A sudden increase may cause disk IO or memory resource strain.

metrics.name: clickhouse_load_average1
metrics.description: Indicates the 1-minute average load of the system running ClickHouse, reflecting short-term system pressure. Comparing with CPU cores helps judge overload (e.g., exceeding 1.5x cores may indicate pressure).

metrics.name: clickhouse_load_average15
metrics.description: Indicates the 15-minute average load of the system running ClickHouse, reflecting long-term system pressure trends. It is suitable for evaluating overall load stability and guiding resource expansion planning.

metrics.name: clickhouse_load_average5
metrics.description: Indicates the 5-minute average load of the system running ClickHouse, reflecting medium-term system pressure changes. Combined with 1-minute and 15-minute indicators, it analyzes load fluctuation trends and sustained status.

metrics.name: clickhouse_memory_resident
metrics.description: Records the resident memory (physical memory) used by ClickHouse process, a key indicator of actual memory occupation. Excessive resident memory may cause insufficient memory, affecting service stability.

metrics.name: clickhouse_memory_virtual
metrics.description: Records the virtual memory used by ClickHouse process, including physical memory and swap space. Excessive virtual memory may indicate memory leaks or insufficient configuration, warning of performance degradation from frequent swapping.

metrics.name: clickhouse_network_receive
metrics.description: Records network bytes received by ClickHouse, reflecting system network input traffic. A sudden increase may indicate massive data import or client query surge, requiring attention to sufficient network bandwidth.

metrics.name: clickhouse_network_send
metrics.description: Records network bytes sent by ClickHouse, reflecting system network output traffic. Related to query result return and data replication, anomalies may affect client data reception or cluster synchronization.

metrics.name: clickhouse_number_of_databases
metrics.description: Records the total number of databases in ClickHouse, reflecting data organization scale and complexity. Excessive databases may increase metadata management overhead, affecting metadata operation efficiency.

metrics.name: clickhouse_number_of_tables
metrics.description: Records the total number of tables (including user tables) in ClickHouse, reflecting data structure complexity. The number is related to query performance and maintenance costs; too many may cause slow metadata loading.

metrics.name: clickhouse_number_of_tables_system
metrics.description: Records the number of ClickHouse system tables, which store service metadata and status information. Anomalies may indicate system table corruption or metadata abnormalities.

metrics.name: clickhouse_query
metrics.description: Reflects real-time status indicators of ClickHouse query operations, usually related to parameters during query execution, helping analyze current query running status and resource occupation.

metrics.name: clickhouse_query_thread
metrics.description: Records the number of threads processing ClickHouse queries, reflecting concurrent query processing capacity. The number should match CPU cores to avoid increased thread switching overhead affecting query efficiency.

metrics.name: clickhouse_query_time_microseconds_total
metrics.description: Accumulatively records total execution time (in microseconds) of all ClickHouse queries, a key indicator for evaluating overall query performance. Average time helps judge if query efficiency declines.

metrics.name: clickhouse_query_total
metrics.description: Records the total number of queries executed by ClickHouse, including all types, reflecting query frequency and overall system load. A sudden increase may indicate business access peaks or abnormal query storms.

metrics.name: clickhouse_read
metrics.description: Records the total number of read operations in ClickHouse, including table data and cache reads, an important indicator of data access pressure. Excessive reads may increase disk IO load.

metrics.name: clickhouse_replicated_send
metrics.description: Records the number of data operations sent by ClickHouse in replicated table mechanism, reflecting data synchronization activity in the cluster. Anomalies may indicate replication link interruption or synchronization delays.

metrics.name: clickhouse_seek_total
metrics.description: Records the total number of file seek operations in ClickHouse, reflecting random disk IO access frequency. Frequent seeks usually indicate disk fragmentation or unreasonable query plans, affecting IO performance.

metrics.name: clickhouse_select_queries_with_subqueries_total
metrics.description: Records the total number of SELECT queries with subqueries in ClickHouse, reflecting the proportion of complex queries. Such queries usually consume more resources; a high proportion may affect overall performance.

metrics.name: clickhouse_select_query_time_microseconds_total
metrics.description: Accumulatively records total execution time (in microseconds) of all ClickHouse SELECT queries, focusing on performance evaluation of read queries, helping analyze efficiency changes of read operations.

metrics.name: clickhouse_select_query_total
metrics.description: Records the total number of SELECT queries executed by ClickHouse, reflecting the frequency of data read operations. It is directly related to read pressure and user query habits; a sudden increase may raise read IO load.

metrics.name: clickhouse_selected_rows_total
metrics.description: Accumulatively records the total number of rows returned by all ClickHouse queries, reflecting total data processing volume. Related to query complexity and data scale, it helps evaluate actual data processing efficiency.

metrics.name: clickhouse_storage_buffer_bytes
metrics.description: Records bytes used in ClickHouse storage buffer, which temporarily caches written data to improve write performance. High buffer usage may increase write latency.

metrics.name: clickhouse_total_space_in_bytes
metrics.description: Indicates the total capacity (bytes) of ClickHouse's overall storage space, including all data storage paths, serving as a basic indicator for storage resource planning.

metrics.name: clickhouse_free_space_in_bytes
metrics.description: Indicates the free capacity (bytes) of ClickHouse's overall storage space, reflecting remaining storage resources. Combined with total space, it calculates overall storage usage to prevent exhaustion.

metrics.name: clickhouse_zoo_keeper_request
metrics.description: Records the number of request interactions between ClickHouse and ZooKeeper (used for distributed coordination), reflecting the activity of coordination operations in distributed clusters.

metrics.name: clickhouse_zoo_keeper_session
metrics.description: Records the number of sessions established between ClickHouse and ZooKeeper, the basis of distributed coordination. Abnormal session interruptions may cause cluster metadata synchronization failures, affecting distributed table availability.

metrics.name: clickhouse_zoo_keeper_transactions_total
metrics.description: Accumulatively records the total number of transactions executed by ClickHouse on ZooKeeper, which ensure atomicity of coordination operations. It reflects the volume and complexity of distributed coordination.

metrics.name: clickhouse_open_file_for_read
metrics.description: Records the number of files opened by ClickHouse for read operations, reflecting disk IO activity of read operations. Excessive files may reach system file descriptor limits, preventing new file openings.

metrics.name: clickhouse_open_file_for_write
metrics.description: Records the number of files opened by ClickHouse for write operations, reflecting disk IO activity of write operations. Together with read files, it reflects overall disk file operation load.

metrics.name: clickhouse_file_open_total
metrics.description: The total number of files opened cumulatively, reflecting the frequency of ClickHouse's file operations. A high value may affect performance, serving as an important indicator of system I/O load.

metrics.name: clickhouse_keeper_alive_connections
metrics.description: The number of current alive connections to ClickHouse Keeper, reflecting real-time communication status. Abnormal connections may affect cluster coordination.

metrics.name: clickhouse_exporter_scrape_failures_total
metrics.description: The total number of cumulative exporter scrape failures, indicating the health of the metric collection link. Frequent failures cause missing monitoring data.
